arma

Class TestData

  • java.lang.Object
    • arma.TestData

  • public class TestData
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides general parameters and all test data used by (parametrised) tests.
    Version:
    0.9
    Author:
    Sebastian Niemann

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int _dimension
      A dimensions of getDimensions().
      static double MAX_NUMERIC_TOLERANCE
      Maximal allowed numeric tolerances.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TestData() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object[]> getDimensions()
      Should return all dimensions in JUnit's parametrisation format, that are used for getHilbertMatrix(int) or getLowerTriangularCholeskyFactorMatrix(int).
      private static Mat getHilbertMatrix(int dimension)
      Creates a new Hilbert matrix of dimension dimension.
      private static Mat getLowerTriangularCholeskyFactorMatrix(int dimension)
      Creates a new lower triangular Cholesky factor matrix of dimension dimension.
      static java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object[]> getTestMatrices()
      Returns a set of test matrices composed of: Simple matrices: Zero matrices (Mat.zeros(int, int)) Matrices of ones (Mat.ones(int, int)) Identity matrices (Mat.eye(int, int)) Ill-conditioned matrices: Hilbert matrices (getHilbertMatrix(int)) Inverse Hilbert matrices (getHilbertMatrix(int).i()) Lower triangular Cholesky factor matrices (testLowerTriangularCholeskyFactorMatrix()) And solutions for: Determinant
      void testHilbertMatrix()
      Test the correctness of Hilbert matrices by checking the assertion n == Math.sqrt(Arma.accu(getHilbertMatrix(n).i()))
      void testLowerTriangularCholeskyFactorMatrix()
      Test the correctness of lower triangular Cholesky factor matrices by checking the assertion getLowerTriangularCholeskyFactorMatrix(n).i() == getLowerTriangularCholeskyFactorMatrix(n)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • getDimensions

        public static java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object[]> getDimensions()
        Should return all dimensions in JUnit's parametrisation format, that are used for getHilbertMatrix(int) or getLowerTriangularCholeskyFactorMatrix(int).
        Returns:
        The dimensions.

      • getTestMatrices

        public static java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object[]> getTestMatrices()
        Returns a set of test matrices composed of: Simple matrices:
        1. Zero matrices (Mat.zeros(int, int))
        2. Matrices of ones (Mat.ones(int, int))
        3. Identity matrices (Mat.eye(int, int))
        Ill-conditioned matrices:
        1. Hilbert matrices (getHilbertMatrix(int))
        2. Inverse Hilbert matrices (getHilbertMatrix(int).i())
        3. Lower triangular Cholesky factor matrices (testLowerTriangularCholeskyFactorMatrix())
        And solutions for:
        1. Determinant
        Returns:
        The test matrices.

      • testHilbertMatrix

        public void testHilbertMatrix()
        Test the correctness of Hilbert matrices by checking the assertion n == Math.sqrt(Arma.accu(getHilbertMatrix(n).i()))

      • testLowerTriangularCholeskyFactorMatrix

        public void testLowerTriangularCholeskyFactorMatrix()
        Test the correctness of lower triangular Cholesky factor matrices by checking the assertion getLowerTriangularCholeskyFactorMatrix(n).i() == getLowerTriangularCholeskyFactorMatrix(n)

      • getHilbertMatrix

        private static Mat getHilbertMatrix(int dimension)
        Creates a new Hilbert matrix of dimension dimension.
        Parameters:
        dimension - The provided dimension.
        Returns:
        The created matrix.

      • getLowerTriangularCholeskyFactorMatrix

        private static Mat getLowerTriangularCholeskyFactorMatrix(int dimension)
        Creates a new lower triangular Cholesky factor matrix of dimension dimension.
        Parameters:
        dimension - The provided dimension.
        Returns:
        The created matrix.
